title: 9.4 Festivals - b34
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor vmbo beroepsgerichte leerweg, leerjaar 3 en 4. Dit is thema 9 'Going out'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Festivals. In deze les gaat het over aspecten van festivals, bijvoorbeeld podia, bands en muziek. De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to catch, to choose, en to come. In de grammaticaopdracht wordt de 'past perfect' behandeld.

items.content:
Het onderwerp van dit blok is festivals.

  • Maak groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.

Bespreek de volgende vragen in jouw groepje:

  • Ga jij wel eens naar een festival?
    Zo ja, waarheen, zo niet, waar zou je heen willen gaan?
  • Wat kun je op een festival zien/horen?
  • Wat voor soort werk wordt er allemaal gedaan om een festival goed te laten verlopen?

Onder andere met deze vragen ga je aan de slag in deze opdracht.
Bekijk hieronder de stappen die je gaat zetten.

Succes.

Step

Glastonbury Song

Festival documentary

Jimmy Kimmel, a TV host in the United States, sends a woman to a well-known music festival in California, called Coachella.
Because music fans like to say they know new bands, the host interviews music fans about fake bands. To see if the fans will pretend that they know them.
Jimmy Kimmel, een tv-presentator in de Verenigde Staten, stuurt een vrouw naar Coachella, een bekend muziekfestival in Californië.
Omdat muziekfans graag zeggen dat ze nieuwe bands allang kennen, interviewt de presentator muziekfans over nepbands. Om te zien of de fans zullen doen alsof ze ze kennen.

  • Bestudeer de woordenlijst.
  • Lees de vragen.
  • Bekijk de video.
  • Beantwoord de vragen.
  • Lees het audio script en sleep de woorden rechts naar de juiste plek in de tekst.

Study the vocabulary.

to wrap up to finish, to end
up-and-coming new, emerging, becoming more popular
to conduct
[an experiment] 		to do an experiment, to try something
venue the place where an event happens, takes place
to make up to create, invent
obscure not well-known: not known to most people
to play "live" to play or give a concert in person
a highlight something (such as an event or a detail) that is very interesting,
exciting, or important: the best part of something
polka

a lively dance and type of music for couples that is popular with older generations in the Midwest United States
innovative having new ideas, creative
straight out of [somewhere] to come from a specific place
to give off to emit, to let out, to send

Lees de vragen.

  • Who created the fake band names?
  • How does the host describe "Shorty Jizzle and the Plumbercracks?"
  • Does anyone admit, or say, that they have not heard of the band?
  • What does the host say Coachella means in an American Indian language?
Watch the video and answer the questions.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

Who created the fake band names?

content.body: The Coachella Valley Music and Arts festival.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

How does the host describe 'Shorty Jizzle and the Plumbercracks? '

content.body: She describes them as a combination between Bob Dylan and a polka band.
She describes them as a combination between DJ Cornmeal and a polka band.
She describes them as a combination between Chelsea Clinton and a polka band.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

Does anyone admit, or say, that they have not heard of the band?

content.body: Only one person says no to know the band.
They haven't been to all the concerts, so they don't know.
No, all the people pretended to have some knowledge of the bands.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

What does the host say Coachella means in an American Indian language?

content.body:
Read the audioscript and fill in the gaps.

One more thing, the Coachella Valley Music and Arts festival wrapped up yesterday.
It's a huge concert. It goes over two weekends. It's out in the middle of the California desert.
More than sixty bands played at Coachella this year. Some of them big bands, some of them not-so-big, some up-and-coming bands.
Music fans in general love knowing about bands that no one else has ever heard of.
So, we decided to conduct an experiment.
We sent a camera crew to Coachella and we asked people walking into the venue what they thought of a bunch of bands whose names we made up.
Okay, these bands are so obscure that they do not exist.
Except for one name you will hear here, we made all of them up, but that didn't stop people from saying they knew them in tonight's special Coachella edition of Lie Witness News.

  • Host: One of my favorite bands this year is "Dr. Schlomo and the GI Clinic."
  • Girl 1: Yeah.
  • Host: Yeah. They're .
  • Girl 1: Yeah, They're always amazing.
  • Host: He's really good on the flexic.
  • Girl 2: Yeah, I'm to see them live. I think that's going to one of the bands that's gonna be really great live.
  • Girl 1: Me too, it's going to be a highlight.
  • Host: Did you see them when they played at Lollapalooza?
  • Girl 1: No.
  • Girl 2: No, I didn't.
  • Host: Aren't you so mad?
  • Girl 1: I know, I'm so mad.
  • Host: Have you heard of "Shorty Jizzle and the Plumbercracks?"
  • Guy: Yep.
  • Host: What do you them? Like, how raw they are?
  • Guy: Yeah, they're, I mean, they're really unique, for sure.
  • Host: They feel a little bit like a between, like, Bob Dylan and, like, a polka band.
  • Guy: Yeah, um.
  • Host: Are you guys as excited as I am about "The Obesity Epidemic?"
  • Guy: I just like their whole style. Like their whole genre, just great. They're kind of, like, they're like, very innovative and they're new.
  • Host: They're some smaller bands that . "Two Door Cinema Club." They're good.
  • Guy: Yeah, I'm looking forward to them.
  • Host: Do you like their album DJ Cornmeal?
  • Guy: Yeah, actually, I, um, had a radio show on a community radio show up in Canada and I used to spin them .
  • Host: Oh, wow, sounds like a great show.
  • Host: One of my favorite bands this year is called "Get the Fuck Out of My Pool."
  • Girl: Yeah, actually, that, I've heard from my friends, I don't know any of their music, but I've heard from all of my friends that it's not something to miss. So I'm not gonna miss it.
  • Host: One of my favorite things today, straight out of Williamsburg, the "Chelsea Clintons."
  • Girl: Yeah, actually, that, I've heard from my friends, I don't know any of their music, but I've heard from all of my friends that it's . So I'm not gonna miss it.
  • Host: One of my favorite things today, straight out of Williamsburg, the "Chelsea Clintons."
  • Girl: Oh, yeah, I have heard of them . No, yeah, I don't know if I'm gonna see them or not. But I do know of their music.
  • Host: What did you hear about them?
  • Girl: Its, they're just fun.
  • Host: What's fun about the "Chelsea Clintons?"
  • Girl: I think they just give off good . Like, you know, and you can just tell that they're doing it from a good place.
    And it's, like, you can just feel energy, I feel. And there's, like, very few acts that, like, give you that feeling.
  • Host: Did you know that Coachella is actually the American Indian word for ?
  • Guy: Really?
  • Girl 1: It's Fucking Coachella Twenty-Thirteen! Woo!
  • Girl 2: We love Coachella.
  • Host: Are you guys excited for "Regis and the Philbin?"
  • Girl 2: Very excited!

items.content:
Glastonbury Festival
You are going to read a text about a famous festival in England.
Je gaat een tekst lezen over een beroemd festival in Engeland.

  • Lees eerst de tekst.
  • Bestudeer de woordenlijst.
  • Maak de oefeningen, assignment 1 en 2.

Read the text.

The Glastonbury Festival takes place on Worthy Farm, Pilton in Somerset in July. Glastonbury is actually the centre of many myths and legends. King Arthur and his wife are supposedly buried in the ruins of Glastonbury Abbey.
Many of its High Street shops are 'New Age' type establishments, being given names such as 'Gothic Image'.
Last year bands like Coldplay, The Killers and The Editors performed at Glastonbury.

Working at Glastonbury Festival.
The Festival is regularly approached about the availability of different types of jobs. In fact, the numbers employed directly by the Festival are relatively small.
If you want to work in event management, rigging and staging, sound, lighting,
electrics, plumbing, event security, tent contractors and so on, the Festival cannot really help you.
Many, if not all, of these specialists are employed by different event management companies that have
established, experienced crew who return year on year.

Cash and Traffic management employ car parking staff. Staff are required to work a minimum of four 12-hour shifts. Market traders do require staff, but in the main they recruit people who live near them and whom they know. If you know traders who come to the Festival, get in touch with them early, as they have a limited number of passes for each stall.

If you go to the Festival and find you are getting a bit short of cash, you might try and find traders of food stalls that are rushed off their feet; some of them will employ extra staff who are already on site.

items.content:
You have read the text and studied the vocabulary, now do the exercise.

Assignment 2

Je wilt graag naar het Glastonbury Festival en je wilt daar ook iets bijverdienen.
Geef bij elke stelling aan of deze juist of onjuist is op grond van de tekst.

  1. De meeste betaalde baantjes gaan naar de lokale bevolking.
  2. Als je eenmaal binnen bent, vind je makkelijk een betaald baantje.
  3. Je kunt er alleen via bepaalde uitzendbureaus aan komen.
  4. Voor een groot deel van het werk worden professionals ingehuurd.

Answers

Bestudeer de woordenlijst.

Woordenlijst Festivals


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bestudeer de volgende drie irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to catch
  • to choose
  • to come

past simple

voltooid deelwoord

Nederlands

caught

caught

vangen

to choose

chose

chosen

kiezen

to come

came

come

komen


Doe de opdrachten.

Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaats in de tabel.

The festival wrapped up yesterday.

Het festival was gisteren .

We decided to conduct an experiment.

We hebben besloten een experiment uit te voeren.

People walking into the venue were interviewed.

Mensen die op de aankwamen werden geïnterviewd.

We made up the names of the bands.

We hebben de namen van de bands .

This band is very innovative.

Deze band is erg .

I used to spin their music all the time.

Ik de hele tijd hun muziek.

I don't think I'll be good at rigging and staging.

Ik denk niet dat ik goed zal zijn in riggen (takelwerk) en .

My friend would like to work in sound and lighting.

Mijn vriend wil bij werken.

My brothers studies for event security.

Mijn broer leert voor .

Festivals need an experienced crew to make the festival a success.

Festival hebben een nodig om het festival te laten slagen.

Don't forget the car parking staff.

Vergeet het niet.

Staff are required to work a minimum of four shifts.

Personeel minimaal 4 diensten te werken.

They work 12-hour shifts.

Ze werken in .

Market traders require staff.

Handelaren .
They recruit people who live near by. Ze mensen die dichtbij wonen.

Vertaal het onderstreepte woord in het Nederland.

People walking into the venue were interviewed.

I used to spin their music all the time.

items.content:
Grammar: Verb tenses

In dit thema herhalen we de werkwoordstijden.

  • Lees de uitleg.
  • Maak de opdracht

Past perfect of simple past

content.body:
Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

I can't believe I (to get) that apartment. I (to submit) my application last week, but I didn't think I had a chance of actually getting it.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

When I (to show) up to take a look around, there were at least twenty other people who (to arrive) before me.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

Most of them (to fill out, already) their applications and were already leaving. The landlord said I could still apply, so I did.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

I (to try) to fill out the form, but I couldn't answer half of the questions.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

They (to want) me to include references, but I didn't want to list my previous landlord because I (to have) some problems with him in the past and I knew he wouldn't recommend me.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

I (to end) up listing my father as a reference.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

It was total luck that he (to decide) to give me the apartment.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

It turns out that the landlord and my father (to go) to high school together.

Fill in the correct form om the verb. Choose between Simple Past and Past Perfect.

He decided that I could have the apartment before he (to look) at my credit report. I really lucked out!

items.content:
Talking about festvials

Choose five questions to discuss in your group.

  1. What are some of the most popular festivals in your country?
  2. What are some of the things that are done at this festival?
  3. What activities normally take place at festivals?
  4. Do you enjoy going to festivals? Why / Why not?
  5. Do you think festivals in your country are over-commercialised or have lost their original meaning?
  6. What local festival in your area or country would be most interesting for a foreign guest, do you think?
  7. How can the government or festival organisers make festivals more relevant to and popular with young people?
  8. How do you feel about attending festivals that attract huge crowds?

Glastonbury Festival

Je hebt een tekst gelezen over het Glastonbury muziekfestival en nu ga je de bijbehorende schrijfopdracht maken.

Je wilt graag naar dit festival toe, maar je hebt niet genoeg geld. Je hoopt er een baantje te vinden. Op de site www.glastonburyfestivals.co.uk heb je gekeken of ze personeel nodig hebben.

Er is behoefte aan mensen die helpen bij het regelen van het verkeer op de parkeerterreinen. Dat soort werk lijkt je wel wat. Je besluit te reageren.

Je vindt de informatie van de website niet duidelijk.
Je besluit een e-mail te schrijven aan Stanley Beale van Cash and Traffic Management Ltd.

  • Maak de schrijfopdracht eerst alleen, daarna vergelijk je jouw e-mail met die van je groepsgenoten.
  • Schrijf een e-mail met je groepje en lever deze in bij je docent.

Je gaat een e-mail schrijven aan Stanley Beale van Cash and Traffic Management Ltd.

Verwerk de volgende punten:

  • Stel jezelf voor (naam, leeftijd, jongen/meisje, nationaliteit)
  • Vertel waar je de informatie over het festival hebt gelezen.
  • Vermeld waarom je de e-mail schrijft.
  • Schrijf op welke werkzaamheden je graag wilt uitvoeren.
  • Informeer naar wat je kunt verdienen met werken op het festival.
  • Sluit af met de vraag of je zo spoedig mogelijk een reactie kunt ontvangen.
  • Zet je naam onder de e-mail.

Vul het schema in en beantwoord de vragen onder het schema.

Activiteit leuk niet leuk makkelijk moeilijk weet ik al nieuw
Listening
Reading
Vocabulary
Grammar
Speaking
Writing

  • Waar moet ik nog aan werken?
  • Wat moet ik nog aan mijn docent vragen?

Glastonbury Song

You are going to listen to Glastonbury Song by The Waterboys.
In the video you'll see images of the Glastonbury Festival.
Can you describe what you see in the video?
Je gaat luisteren naar Glastonbury Song van The Waterboys.
In de video zie je afbeeldingen van het Glastonbury Festival.
Kun je beschrijven wat je in de video ziet?

  • Bekijk de video.
  • Vorm groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.
  • Bespreek de video.
